sections.title: Setup
sections.text:
To get started download our loader from here:
fluent.gg/loader.exe

Make sure your antivirus is disabled before downloading.
It is highly recommended to run our loader from an USB drive.
It is best to download it straight to your USB drive.

Here are the requirements for running our loader:
Windows 10/11 (Insider/preview builds and custom Windows ISOs are not supported)

64-bit CPU with AVX instruction set

Fast boot disabled

No running hypervisors (some machines might require disabling virtualisation)

Anti-virus disabled

Administrator privilege

Secure boot disabled

sections.title: How to Use the Loader
sections.text: Make sure you have your game closed before launching the loader.

sections.title: How to Inject
sections.text:
Run loader as administrator from USB drive (doing otherwise is not recommended and might result in bans). (You might get a message that you have to turn something off, you can get more details below)

Login or create an account if you do not have such already.

Click and highlight the product you want to inject on the left side. You can see the status and expiration date on the right.

Click “Inject” to load the product.

Wait for the loader to fully close.

Unplug your USB.

Now you can start your game.

sections.title: How to Activate a Key
sections.text:
Run loader as administrator from USB drive (doing otherwise is not recommended and might result in bans). (You might get a message that you have to turn something off, you can get more details below)

Login or create an account if you do not have such already.

Paste in your key in the “License Key” field and press the “Activate Key” button. If you encounter any issues make sure you have no extra space in your key!

sections.title: Game Specific Section: Rust
sections.text:
Built-in spoofer has a seed file, you should delete it after each ban.
C:\hwid_seed.bin

If you experience bans, reinstall Windows and disable Windows Defender using Defender Control before downloading/launching loader.

sections.title: How to Disable Fast Boot
sections.text:
RECOMMENDED: You can disable fast boot in your BIOS (you should check your motherboard manual for more details)

Disable fast boot in Windows

Open Control Panel

Select Power Options

On the left side click on “Choose what the power button does”

Click “Change settings that are currently unavailable”

Make sure there is no checkmark next to “Turn on fast startup (recommended)”, if you do not see this option, you have it already disabled in BIOS

Click “Save changes”

Restart your computer

sections.title: How to Disable Hypervisors
sections.text:
Official hypervisors (Hyper-V, etc):

Open Command prompt as Administrator

Run this command
bcdedit /set {current} hypervisorlaunchtype off

Restart your computer

Unofficial hypervisors

Disable virtualisation in BIOS or get instructions from the maker of the hypervisor you are running

sections.title: How to Disable Windows Defender
sections.text:
It is recommended to use Defender Control

Defender Control v2.1

How to turn off defender without 3rd party tools:

Turn off Defender antivirus protection in Windows Security - Microsoft Support
